CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "Is The Customer Always Right?....Pittsburgh Waitresses Reveal Some Of The Problems They Confront - Business Ethics Demand That Waitresses Reveal Some Of The Problems They Confront - Business Ethics Demand That Waitresses Please and Pamper Customers...But It Isn't Always Easy!... In No. 2 men demonstrate how a heckler looks.  A 'wise-guy' smile is the first requirement. 'Barroom Romeos' are the waitresses' greatest problems.  They sit around taverns trying to 'make' girls who serve them.  Usually well dressed and young, they try to date waitresses and stick around until the wee hours of the morning sometimes following them home...  Photos by Harris"
TitMainTitle: Eleven men, including Leon "Pigmeat" Clark, gathered in front of bar with sign for Zivic vs. Turiello boxing match, possibly Crawford Grill No. 1
